intro: Melica pannosa var. schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian flatgrass, is a perennial grass species native to high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, flat leaves that are often covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to rocky or mountainous soils. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
